1541833193_19HaBBc1M3usmLxayEasbaTkeZ3Tt.body:
Why not a privacy coin like PIVX or Monero? 

PIVX has zPIV functionality which allows for anonymous transactions and even anonymous staking.

1541565435_15TSdTU5ZrAHXXiMQvMUEEUm17GFt.body: I would second the ability for a member to mute someone else, in the sense that if I would mute monsterjazz, only I would no longer see their posts. Me muting someone else wouldn't affect anyone else's ability to see that member. Nobody gets censored, this just allows individuals to turn a deaf ear and is no different from select crowdmembers putting in headphones during a talk/seminar. The speaker is still talking, just certain people have chosen to tune them out in a way that doesn't affect others from listening.

I know. I saw that shortly after posting but left my post alone to show my support for the feature.

Is going to ZeroID, typing in the username, and hitting mute the proper way to do it?
Awesome. Doubt I'll use it much, though. I tend to ignore and keep scrolling. Others may find that info really handy.

1541360464_154aXdhb7aoQmT62rxDp6HKte3V1j.body:
If I seed a few videos on KopyKate, I can then go offline and watch them, which is a double benefit for making video "streaming" work on slow connections. That benefit alone is enough to not delete sites after visiting (unless it contains something I wouldn't want residing on my computer).

My instance says the port is closed. Would anyone be able to pull my seeded files with the port closed?
True, but if the port is closed, is your computer publicly seeding stored zites/files?
